name: Black Lemur
description: This species is characterized by pronounced sexual dimorphism. Males have black fur and vivid orange eyes, while females are light brown with hazel eyes.
food_note: Mainly fruits, also seeds, leaves, flowers, nectar, mushrooms, occasionally invertebrates
image_alt: Black Lemur, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 38–45 cm; tail length 51–64 cm; weight up to 2 kg
reproduction: Females give birth to 1–2 young after 127 days of gestation
attractions: It spends most of its time in trees, resting and foraging. It is active during the day and at dusk. Due to its fondness for pollen, it is a key pollinator of many Madagascan plants.
breeding: We have kept these lemurs since 2002. Male Kiwi and female Meg became parents to the first raised young in 2005. Kiwi has since passed away, but Meg still lives at the zoo and raised her fourteenth offspring in 2013.
